results.title: Just smile and shine
results.creator_credit: Anna Huynh, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Anna Huynh tells of how she learned the hard way the pitfalls of trying to fit in. Looking different to everyone else, she tried doing everything her peers were doing and it took her further away from herself. In being true to herself, she discovered the true friendship and, ultimately, her true self.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anna Huynh, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Prayer for fame
results.creator_credit: Angela Josifoska, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Angela Josifoska, a teenager living in Melbourne’s western suburbs, tells of her quest for fame. She shares her early youth and the things that interested her throughout her life, culminating in a passion for performance. She candidly shares her dreams and ambitions for the future and her determination to succeed shines through.

results.title: Anthony Lucas talks about 'The Cabinet of Anthony Lucas: The Faulty Fandangle'
results.creator_credit: Jason White, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Oscar nominated animator Anthony Lucas (‘The Mysterious Geographic Explorations of Jasper Morello’) speaks candidly about his creative processes and inspirations. He introduces his latest work, ‘The Cabinet of Anthony Lucas: The Faulty Fandangle’, commissioned for ACMI’s ‘Screen Worlds’ exhibition. He takes us on a creative adventure from beginning to end, starting with initial ideas and inspiration, right through to the creation of the on-screen animation and mechanised components.
results.title_for_label: Anthony Lucas talks about ‘The Cabinet of Anthony Lucas: The Faulty Fandangle’
results.description: Oscar nominated animator Anthony Lucas (‘The Mysterious Geographic Explorations of Jasper Morello’) speaks candidly about his creative processes and inspirations. results.title: Home in the high country
results.creator_credit: Trevor Larner and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Trevor Larner first discovered the Victorian high country as a teenager. He initially wanted to get to the highest point, but then fell in love with the vegetation and beauty of the Alpine region. Eventually he started working there maintaining infrastructure, building ski lodges and repairing the huts of the early pioneers. When Trevor went back to visit in 2008, it felt like he was coming home.

results.title: The Honeymoon
results.creator_credit: Laurel Whitcroft (Allen) and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: My family has a tradition of holidaying at Mt Buffalo Chalet, that has continued through four generations. A family album of the holidays in the Victorian Alps taken initially by Laurel and her husband for their honeymoon, then the subsequent returns by the growing family throughout the decades.
results.description: My family has a tradition of holidaying at Mt Buffalo Chalet, that has continued through four generations. results.title: The Dulugar
results.creator_credit: James Hackell and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: My love of stories and my love of the bush grew at the same time. Stories bring the land to life. A story about a man’s connection to his Indigenous ancestors through the Victorian Alpine country and the stories that would pass through the generations, especially the one about the Dulugar, a fierce creature said to exist in the region, haunting campers with their red eyes and devil-like smell.
results.description: My love of stories and my love of the bush grew at the same time. Stories bring the land to life. A story about a man’s connection to his Indigenous ancestors through the Victorian Alpine country and the stories that would pass through the generations, especially the one about the Dulugar, a fierce creature said to exist in the region, haunting campers with their red eyes and devil-like smell.

results.title: In search of golden footprints
results.creator_credit: Andrew Swift and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Andrew Swift was raised in a small mining town in the foothills of the Victorian Alpine country. The more he learnt about the history of mining in the region, the more his interest in the remote areas of the Alps increased. Andrew’s exploration of the area has unearthed evidence of the long forgotton gold mines and the stories of the people who worked there.
results.description: Andrew Swift was raised in a small mining town in the foothills of the Victorian Alpine country. The more he learnt about the history of mining in the region, the more his interest in the remote areas of the Alps increased. Andrew’s exploration of the area has unearthed evidence of the long forgotton gold mines and the stories of the people who worked there.

results.title: How I see it on the street
results.creator_credit: Robbie Williams and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: The way I see it, there are a lot of bums in the world. Stories from a Big Issue vendor who operates from a wheelchair, about the variety of bums in the world and how they behave towards him.

results.title: Homage to the herbster
results.creator_credit: Leo Kane and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Sometimes he inscribes his name in wet cement. As long as he spells it correctly, I’ll let it ride. A simple tale of an intense relationship between a Big Issue vendor and his terrier, his partner in both work and life.

results.creator_credit: Kylie O'Brien and ACMI Digital Storytelling
